summary: This is an email exchange from March 2002 between 'G. Max' and 'The Invisible Man' discussing arranging a trip to Peru for 'Andrew' to see the Nazca Lines, with an emphasis on providing '2 legged sight seeing' (intelligent, pretty women from good families) and ensuring discretion to avoid media attention.

persons.name: G. Max
persons.context: Email sender who provides Andrew's contact information and instructions for a trip to Peru, emphasizing discretion and the provision of female companionship.

persons.name: The Invisible Man
persons.context: Email recipient who is asked to arrange a trip in Peru for Andrew, including sightseeing and introducing him to trustworthy, discreet, and fun female companions.

persons.name: Andrew
persons.context: An English-sounding gentleman for whom G. Max is arranging a discreet trip to Peru to see the Nazca Lines, with implied interest in female companionship.

connections.description: G. Max is arranging a trip for Andrew, has his telephone number, and provides instructions about his preferences and need for discretion.
Email exchange shows a familiar relationship, with G. Max relying on The Invisible Man to host Andrew and provide a discreet, fun experience.
The Invisible Man is expected to be Andrew's tour guide in Peru and introduce him to trustworthy female companions.

events.title: Email arranging Peru trip for Andrew
events.description: G. Max emails The Invisible Man to arrange a trip to Peru for Andrew to see the Nazca Lines, with instructions for discreet female companionship.

keyFacts: The email discusses arranging a trip to Peru for 'Andrew' to see the Nazca Lines.
Instructions include providing '2 legged sight seeing' described as 'intelligent pretty fun and from good families', implying arranged female companionship.
A strong emphasis is placed on discretion: 'He does not want to read about any trip in the papers whom or what he saw.'
The correspondence suggests a network facilitating travel and social introductions for wealthy or influential individuals.
